TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MessageType extends ExchangeWebServices.ItemType

Docs.summary: The class represents an Exchange e-mail message in a mailbox.

remarks.para: The class has many members that are read-only but that have a setter for the property. This is an artifact from the definition in the schema file. For example, the property cannot be set when you are creating a message. This property is returned when a message item is received in a response from the computer that is running Exchange Server 2007.
You do not have to set the property on the object unless you want to create a custom subtype of IPM.Note. The Exchange server handles the as an IPM.Note.

objects represent e-mail messages and all other items that are not strongly typed by the Exchange Web Services (EWS) schema. Items such as IPM.Sharing and IPM.InfoPath are returned as objects. Versions of Exchange Server starting with Exchange 2010 and Exchange Online do not return the base object in responses.

example.para: The following code example shows how to create a message. Note that a message that is returned in a response will have many other properties that are set by the Exchange server.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ BccRecipients { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a collection of recipients that receive a blind carbon copy (Bcc) of an e-mail. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns an array.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ CcRecipients { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a collection of recipients that receive a carbon copy (Bcc) of an e-mail. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns an array.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <System::Byte> ^ ConversationIndex { cli::array <System::Byte> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the identifier to the thread to which the message belongs. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a byte array.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ConversationTopic { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the conversation identifier. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a string that represents the conversation identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::SingleRecipientType ^ From { ExchangeWebServices::SingleRecipientType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::SingleRecipientType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the addressee from whom the message was sent. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a that represents the addressee from whom the message was sent.Only the Name property is returned in a FindItem call. The EmailAddress property is not returned in a FindItem call.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ InternetMessageId { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the Internet message identifier for the message. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a string that represents the Internet message identifier for the message.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsDeliveryReceiptRequested { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the sender of the item requests a delivery receipt. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns true if a delivery receipt is requested; otherwise, the property returns false.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsDeliveryReceiptRequestedSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request. This property is required if the property is specified. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsRead { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the message has been read. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the message has been read; otherwise, the property returns false.

remarks.para: This property is returned in a response that describes a message. This property cannot be set for a request. An error will occur if this property is set in a request.
You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsReadReceiptRequested { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the sender of a message requests a read receipt. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The returns true if a read receipt is requested; otherwise, the property returns false.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsReadReceiptRequestedSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request. This property is required if the property is specified. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsReadSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request. This property is required if the property is specified. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsResponseRequested { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether a response to an e-mail is requested. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The returns true if a response is requested; otherwise, the property returns false.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsResponseRequestedSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request. This property is required if the property is specified. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ References { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a string that represents the Usenet header that is used to correlate replies with their original message. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a string that represents a Usenet header.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ ReplyTo { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a collection of addresses to which replies should be sent. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns an array that contains a set of addresses to which replies should be sent.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::SingleRecipientType ^ Sender { ExchangeWebServices::SingleRecipientType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::SingleRecipientType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the sender of a message. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a object.Only the Name property is returned in a FindItem call. The EmailAddress property is not returned in a FindItem call.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ ToRecipients { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::EmailAddressType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a collection of recipients of an e-mail. This property is required for sending a message. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns an array that contains a set of addresses to which e-mail are sent.
